text.value:
"Would you like to talk about family planning today? There are many effective methods that might work well for you to prevent or delay pregnancy. It is very important for the health of both a woman and her baby to delay pregnancy for at least 2 years after giving birth. And, if you have fulfilled desire to have babies , being on contraception helps you to prevent unwanted pregnancies. Women use family planning methods for many reasons. Some contraceptive methods also have additional benefits such as making your monthly bleeds less heavy.
If you are interested, I have different cards and contraception samples, which I can show you and discuss. First, I will ask you a few questions to help you decide which family planning methods might work best for you. I will discuss the methods that are available, the benefits, some of the possible side effects, and how you can access the methods. This is called balanced counselling and the counselling can help you to make decision on starting on a new contraception or change your current contraception. This will only take 5-10 minutes."

"Ask: Do you have any questions about your current family planning methods?
Counseling Say: Condoms are important for all women and can be used along with other family planning methods. Condoms when used consistently and correctly are important both for family planning and to prevent HIV/sexually transmissed infections. They can be used along with other methods of family planning. Emergency contraception can be used after you have had sex without a condom or if the condom breaks. It is most effective if taken within 72 hours but may be effective for up to 5 days. You can get emergency contraception at the health post"
Do you want to receive this counselling with your husband?
Is your husband at home now?
Invite the husband and provide counselling to the couple together
Are you exclusively breastfeeding your baby?
Set aside card for LAM. Say: This method requires that you are exclusively breastfeeding your baby.
Are you breastfeeding a baby less than 6 months old?
Set aside card for pills. Say: The hormones in these pills may affect breastfeeding.
Set aside card for LAM. Say: Since you are not breastfeeding you cannot use this method for family planning.

"Thank the woman for her time today. Say: In order to help you choose a family planning method, I will be using these cards.
INSTRUCTION: Display all cards in this order and briefly introduce each method:
1. Female sterilization 2. Vasectomy 3. Implant 4. IUCD 5. LAM 6. Injectable/Depo 7. Pills 8. Male Condom
Set Emergency Contraception card aside."
Set aside card for LAM. Say: You are not an under 6 month postpartum mother as a result you cannot use this method for family planning.
Do you want to have children in the future?
"Set aside tubal ligation (Female Sterilization) and Vasectomy cards. Say: These methods are permanent so you would not be able to have children in the future."
Do you have any other medical problems?

"Recommend referral to health facilty for additional counseling or request for CHN home visit.
Counseling: Condoms are important for all women. Condoms when used consistently and correctly are important both for family planning and to prevent HIV/sexually transmissed infections. They can be used along with other methods of family planning.Discuss patient with CHN at next 1:1."
Any traditional method ( Withdrawal/ Rhythm/ Calendar)
Make plan and referral for woman to access method or to continue method.
Did the woman choose a family planning method?

Counsel on condoms and emergency contraception. Condoms are important for all women. Condoms when used consistently and correctly are important both for family planning and to prevent HIV/sexually transmissed infections. Emergency contraception can be used after you had had sex without a condom. It is most effective if taken within 72 hours but may be effective for up to 5 days. You can get emergency contraception at the health post
Are there any methods that you do not want to use or did not like in the past?
Set aside cards for methods woman does not want to use.

"1. Arrange the remaining cards from most effective to least effective method 2. Review the methods on the cards. 3. Ask woman if she would like to choose a method 4. Review chosen method in detail. Make sure no contraindications 5. Review information on method including side effects and where woman can access method."
Does your partner support you in family planning?
"Set aside card for Condoms and Vasectomy. Say: These methods require your partner to be supportive."
If you have had a baby recently have your monthly periods returned?
"Set aside card for LAM. Say: This method requires that you do not have your monthly periods."
Is the woman 35 years or older and a smoker?
Set aside card for pills. Explain that pills are not recommended for women who smoke and are older than 35 years old. Smoking can have harmful health effects.
Misconceptions, misinformation, or lack of knowledge about family planning (think family planning is harmful to health, will cause future sterility, etc.)
Why does your husband not support you in family planning?

"Counsel: Condoms are important for all women but it can be difficult if your husband is not supportive. Condoms when used consistently and correctly are important both for family planning and to prevent HIV/sexually transmitted infections. They can be used along with other methods of family planning."
Would like to consider options further
Would like to discuss with her partner
Needs additional referral or CHN visit
Concerned about side effects or health effects of contraception
Say: If you change your mind you can go to the health post for counseling and family planning options.
Do you have have high blood pressure?
"Set aside card for Pills. Say: Pills are not recommended for women with hypertension."
Does the woman agree to receive counseling from you?
Patient does not want counseling service
If no, please select a reason
This woman's BP is very high. She has Severe Hypertension. Please refer her to the hospital immediately.
Counsel the woman to drink lot of water and have her blood pressure re-checked at the Health Post or Home visit within the next week.
Please refer this woman to the hospital immediately.
This woman's BP is low. Does she have any of the following symptoms?

"If you do not want to have another child soon, then you need to think about using contraceptive methods.
You can use LAM as a contraception under these three conditions: 1)If your baby is under 6 months old, 2) baby is exclusively breastfed 3) your menses has not returned
(If depo is available now, tell this): You can also use depo. If you get this once, it will work for 3 months. \ You can also get condoms and pills from health facilities at this time. However, You should not pills under these conditions: a) If you are breastfeeding baby under 6 months old b) If you have high blood pressure c) If you are smoker and older than 35 years.
(If implant and copper-T also available in any health facilities at this time, tell this) : If you don't want to have another baby for a while, then you can also use implant and copper-T. Implant works for 5 years and copper-T works for 10 years. You can take them out any time you want."
Any traditional method? ( rhythm method/ calendar / withdrawal)
Are you currently doing something or using any method to delay or avoid getting pregnant?
You have reached the end of the PNC form. If you need to go back and double check your answers you may do so. Otherwise, you can proceed ahead and save the form. Thank you.
You should visit her again for PNC on:
You should visit her again for PSS on:

Delivery Date:
Delivery Date (Nepali):
Post Pregnancy Days:
Thank her husband for being present in the visit.
Is husband present in the visit?
In the last 12 months has your husband been away from your home community for more than 1 month at a time?
Is mother-in-law present in the counseling?

Counseling:
This measurement indicates that your nutrition status normal. A healthy diet during the postpartum period is the same as a healthy pregnancy diet. While you are healing from birth and breastfeeding your child, it is important to continue a healthy diet.

Counseling:
This measurement indicates that you may be underweight. This may have an impact on you and your baby during the postpartum period. It will be important for you to eat a healthy diet during the postpartum period and try to gain weight.A healthy diet during the postpartum period is the same as a healthy pregnancy diet. While you are healing from birth and breastfeeding your child, it is important to continue a healthy diet. Note to CHW: Review healthy pregnancy/postpartum diet counseling with the mother.
Do you want to record a MUAC measurement?
This form is to provide Post Natal Care to women who were recently pregnant.
If this patient has died , her case will be closed and she will be removed from care delivery.
If this patient has permanently migrated, then she will be removed from care delivery forms
Will be back anytime withing 6 months.
Temporary Migration Gone for more than 6 months but less than a year
Don't know where this person has gone to.
Permanent Migration(gone for more than 1 year)
Please provide a reason for his/her absence.
Is the woman available at home?
Please refer this woman to the hospital immediately. Assist with any arrangements needed and notify your supervisor.
Does she have any of the following?
Please refer this woman to the hospital immediately. Assist with any arrangements needed and notify your supervisor.
Refer to Health Post for urine dip and possible antibiotics.
Do you have any of the following symptoms?
Do you have burning with urination?
If mild abdominal pain and no other symptoms, provide reassurance.
Please refer this woman to the hospital immediately. Assist with any arrangements needed and notify your supervisor.
Do you have fever and/or severe abdominal pain?
Please refer this woman to the hospital immediately. Assist with any arrangements needed and notify your supervisor.
Do you have any heavy bleeding?
Counseling: It is important to take these tablets daily for your nutrition and the nutrition of your baby. If you have run out, you can get them from a health facility.
Are you taking Iron-Folic Acid tablets daily?
Please refer this woman to the hospital immediately. Assist with any arrangements needed and notify your supervisor.

Calf or lower leg pain can be common after delivery. However, if you develop swelling in one leg more than the other, shortness of breath, or chest pain, it is important to go to the hospital immediately as these can be signs of a blood clot in your lungs.
Swelling in one leg more than the other
Do you have any of these symptoms?
Do you have calf or lower leg pain?
Please refer this woman to the hospital immediately. Assist with any arrangements needed and notify your supervisor.
Do you have any of the following symptoms of severe pre-eclampsia?
During your last visit, this woman was immediately referred to a health facility due to a danger sign. Did she visit the health facility?
Date of most recent blood pressure
Do you want to record her bp?

Counsel on postpartum mood changes:
Because of the hormone/chemical changes in your body after pregnancy, it is very common to feel sad for no specific reason. These feelings will pass.If you are feeling so sad that you cannot care for you or your family or you think about hurting yourself or someone else, it is very important to see a health worker. These may be signs of postpartum depression, which needs treatment with medication
Please refer this woman to the hospital immediately. Assist her if necessary and inform your supervisor.
Refer to the health post to examine breast pain.
If yes, do you have fever or soft mass?
Please refer this woman to the hospital immediately. Assist her if necessary and inform your supervisor.
Over the past two weeks how often have you been bothered by feeling down, depressed, or hopeless?

Over the past two weeks how often have you been bothered by little interest or pleasure in doing things?
"
Have you had any feelings of hurting yourself, your baby, or someone else?
This woman was referred for postpartum depression in the last visit. Did she complete the visit?
During your last visit, this woman was immediately referred to a health facility due to a danger sign. Did she visit the health facility?

if(( /post_natal_care_form/age != '' and /post_natal_care_form/age < 40) or ( /post_natal_care_form/pp_days_ctx != '' and /post_natal_care_form/pp_days_ctx < 730) or ( /post_natal_care_form/lmp_days_calc != '' and /post_natal_care_form/lmp_days_calc < 365) or /post_natal_care_form/contraceptive_current = 'injectables' or /post_natal_care_form/contraceptive_current = 'implants', 1, 0)

bind.jr:constraintMsg: You cannot select additional options when you select None.
You cannot select additional options when you select None.

bind.relevant: selected( /post_natal_care_form/until_6_weeks_questions/group_assessment_preeclampsia/until_6_weeks_questions_preeclampsia_symptoms , 'severe_ha') or selected( /post_natal_care_form/until_6_weeks_questions/group_assessment_preeclampsia/until_6_weeks_questions_preeclampsia_symptoms , 'blurred_vision') or selected( /post_natal_care_form/until_6_weeks_questions/group_assessment_preeclampsia/until_6_weeks_questions_preeclampsia_symptoms , 'severe_epigastric_pain') or selected( /post_natal_care_form/until_6_weeks_questions/group_assessment_preeclampsia/until_6_weeks_questions_preeclampsia_symptoms , 'convulsions')

bind.jr:constraintMsg: You cannot select additional options when you select None.
Must be more than 70 and less than 220
Must be greater than 40 and less than 120.
Date cannot be in the future.

bind.constraint: if(selected(., 'none'), count-selected(.) <= 1, if(( /post_natal_care_form/inputs/number_of_births = '1' and ( /post_natal_care_form/inputs/child_status1 = 'dead' or /post_natal_care_form/inputs/birth_outcome1 = 'still_birth')) or ( /post_natal_care_form/inputs/number_of_births = '2' and ( /post_natal_care_form/inputs/child_status1 = 'dead' or /post_natal_care_form/inputs/birth_outcome1 = 'still_birth') and ( /post_natal_care_form/inputs/child_status2 = 'dead' or /post_natal_care_form/inputs/birth_outcome2 = 'still_birth')) or ( /post_natal_care_form/inputs/number_of_births = '3' and ( /post_natal_care_form/inputs/child_status1 = 'dead' or /post_natal_care_form/inputs/birth_outcome1 = 'still_birth') and ( /post_natal_care_form/inputs/child_status2 = 'dead' or /post_natal_care_form/inputs/birth_outcome2 = 'still_birth') and ( /post_natal_care_form/inputs/child_status3 = 'dead' or /post_natal_care_form/inputs/birth_outcome3 = 'still_birth')) or ( /post_natal_care_form/inputs/number_of_births = '4' and ( /post_natal_care_form/inputs/child_status1 = 'dead' or /post_natal_care_form/inputs/birth_outcome1 = 'still_birth') and ( /post_natal_care_form/inputs/child_status2 = 'dead' or /post_natal_care_form/inputs/birth_outcome2 = 'still_birth') and ( /post_natal_care_form/inputs/child_status3 = 'dead' or /post_natal_care_form/inputs/birth_outcome3 = 'still_birth') and ( /post_natal_care_form/inputs/child_status4 = 'dead' or /post_natal_care_form/inputs/birth_outcome4 = 'still_birth')), not(selected(., 'lact_amenorrhea') and count-selected(.) >= 1), count-selected(.) >= 1))
bind.jr:constraintMsg: You cannot select both 'None' and other options at the same time or select LAM if more than 6 months postpartum or if she is exclusively breastfeeding or if her menses have returned.
She said she was exclusively breastfeeding in the beginning of the form.So cannot select No here.
Cannot select No sex and Infrequent Sex at the same time

bind.calculate: format-date(date(if(if( /post_natal_care_form/next_visit_next_visit_due_pnc = '', decimal-date-time('9999-12-31'), decimal-date-time( /post_natal_care_form/next_visit_next_visit_due_pnc )) < if( /post_natal_care_form/next_visit_next_visit_due_pss = '', decimal-date-time('9999-12-31'), decimal-date-time( /post_natal_care_form/next_visit_next_visit_due_pss )), decimal-date-time( /post_natal_care_form/next_visit_next_visit_due_pnc ), decimal-date-time( /post_natal_care_form/next_visit_next_visit_due_pss ))), '%Y-%m-%d')

if( /post_natal_care_form/patient_information/pre_form_calc_pp_days <= 30 or ( /post_natal_care_form/patient_information/group_assessment_athome/reason_absence = 'gone_for_work' or /post_natal_care_form/patient_information/group_assessment_athome/reason_absence = 'location_unknown' or /post_natal_care_form/patient_information/group_assessment_athome/reason_absence = 'back_6_month' or /post_natal_care_form/patient_information/group_assessment_athome/reason_absence = 'cannot_reach_on_call'), date(today() + 30), if( /post_natal_care_form/patient_information/group_assessment_athome/reason_absence = 'back_in_1_year', date(today() + 90), ''))

select1.hint: Heavy bleeding is when the woman soaks through her clothes or pad in one hour.
Exclusive breastfeeding is when the infant receives only breast milk, without any additional food or drink (that includes animal milk), not even water.
